text: [Music]
hey seers the words we hear and tell
ourselves can affect our self-esteem
deeply sometimes without us even
realizing it toxic phrases are more than
just words they have a profound impact
on our mental health they can sew seeds
of Doubt trigger feelings of inadequacy
trap you in a cycle of negative thinking
and even contribute to conditions like
depression and anxiety additionally
these negative comments can have have a
subtle effect making you withdraw from
social interactions and opportunities so
do you find yourself feeling down
without knowing the reason why could it
be the words you tell yourself or hear
every day let's find out you're just
lucky hearing you're just lucky or you
must be lucky can feel like a slap in
the face it can make you feel like your
success happened by chance and not
because of your hard work this can hurt
yourself esteem because it suggests that
you didn't really earn your achievements
imagine preparing really hard for an
interview and getting the job but
someone says you just got lucky it feels
unfair right it takes away the credit
you deserve and makes you feel like your
efforts don't matter which can diminish
your sense of accomplishment and make
you doubt your abilities here's the
thing people don't always see the effort
you put in what matters is your your
recognition instead of letting this
comment bother you remind yourself I
worked hard for this and I deserve it
celebrate your achievements and
acknowledge your efforts this will boost
your self-belief motivation and
determination for future
success why can't you be more like
someone
else comparison is the thief of Joy it
makes you focus on what you lack instead
of appreciating what you have this can
make you feel inferior inadequate and
unworthy leading to self-doubt and a
loss of confidence instead of trying to
be someone else focus on being the best
version of yourself you are not meant to
be a carbon copy of someone else you are
a unique individual with your own
strengths weaknesses and quirks focus on
what you do well and what makes you
special set goals based on your interest
and skills and when you catch yourself
comparing list three things you're proud
of or three things you've done well this
keeps your focus on your own growth your
worth isn't based on comparisons your
unique story and qualities are what make
you special like this video subscribe
for more are you really going aware that
this question might seem simple but it
carries a judgmental undertone it subtly
suggests your choice is wrong or
inadequate makes you doubt your judgment
and feel self-conscious about your
appearance although this question may
come from someone intending to offer
help over time it can reduce your
confidence and make you second guess
your own
decisions when you hear this trust your
instincts style and decisions instead of
letting this phrase make you doubt
yourself affirm your choice by saying I
like my style and I feel good about it
this helps you stay confident and true
to your unique preferences you'll never
find someone who loves you phrases like
this make you feel Unworthy of love
people who say this often want to
control you making you believe no one
else will love you so you stay with them
even if they treat you badly sometimes
these thoughts come from our own
insecurities especially when we feel
down hearing or thinking this phrase
makes you focus on what you think is
wrong with you instead of what's good
about you it damages your confidence and
selfworth leading you to doubt that you
deserve a loving relationship remember
remember everyone deserves love
including you you don't need to be
perfect to be loved the right person
will love you as you are and help you
grow remind yourself I am worth loving
and will find someone who values me or
I'm focusing on loving myself and the
right relationship will come this helps
protect your self-esteem and believe
that you're deserving a loving
relationship don't be so
dramatic this phrase damag self-esteem
by dismissing and invalidating your
emotions it suggests that your feelings
are exaggerated or unwarranted making
you doubt the validity of your emotional
responses over time hearing this phrase
can affect your ability to express
yourself openly and
authentically it may lead you to feel
ashamed or embarrassed for having strong
emotions which undermines your
self-confidence and self-worth however
it's important to recognize that it's
okay okay to feel deeply your emotions
are valid and important instead of
internalizing this criticism remind
yourself that my feelings matter and I
have the right to express them this
affirmation helps you acknowledge and
honor your emotions ultimately
protecting your
self-esteem we've seen how words can
deeply affect our self-esteem so let's
be kind in how we speak to ourselves and
those around us let's use our words to
uplift one another not bring each other
down and remember you have the power to
protect your
self-esteem what if we all made a pact
to replace toxic phrases with
encouraging ones imagine the Boost in
confidence we'd all feel maybe start
today by identifying those negative
thoughts and turning them into positive
affirmations these little changes can
make a big difference after all we all
deserve to be happy and live our best
lives are you struggling with low
self-esteem therapy can be a great way
to get support and build your
confidence what's a toxic phrase you've
struggled with share it and let's
support each other in the comments
curious about more toxic statements
check out our video for toxic quotes you
should never follow
